segment.target: Winlogon Notification Events

segment.source: Explorer Initialization Duration
segment.target: Explorer Initialization Duration

segment.source: Most Applicable to: Startup application developers
segment.target: Most Applicable to: Startup application developers

segment.source: Relevant Assessments:
segment.target: Relevant Assessments:

segment.source: Boot Performance (Fast Startup)
segment.target: Boot Performance (Fast Startup)

segment.source: This metric captures the time from the end of the Winlogon phase until the Windows Shell (Explorer.exe) reports an initialized Start Screen.
segment.target: This metric captures the time from the end of the Winlogon phase until the Windows Shell (Explorer.exe) reports an initialized Start Screen.

segment.source: It includes the start of the userinit.exe process, which in turn starts Explorer.exe.
segment.target: It includes the start of the userinit.exe process, which in turn starts Explorer.exe.

segment.source: It also includes the initiation of startup applications that are stored in RunOnce registry keys.
segment.target: It also includes the initiation of startup applications that are stored in RunOnce registry keys.

segment.source: Typical Influencing Factors
segment.target: Typical Influencing Factors

segment.source: In the absence of RunOnce applications, most of the time in this phase should be spent initializing the Explorer process.
segment.target: In the absence of RunOnce applications, most of the time in this phase should be spent initializing the Explorer process.

segment.source: Explorer reads a number of libraries and data files into memory during its initialization process.
segment.target: Explorer reads a number of libraries and data files into memory during its initialization process.

segment.source: Contending I/O from other running components can interfere with and delay this activity.
segment.target: Contending I/O from other running components can interfere with and delay this activity.

segment.source: Analysis and Remediation Steps
segment.target: Analysis and Remediation Steps

segment.source: Specific issues are usually generated for longer durations of the Explorer Initialization phase.
segment.target: Specific issues are usually generated for longer durations of the Explorer Initialization phase.

segment.source: You can gain more insight by opening WPA to the time interval of the Explorer Initialization activity.
segment.target: You can gain more insight by opening WPA to the time interval of the Explorer Initialization activity.

segment.source: Avoid placing applications in the RunOnce key on a recurring basis because it delays Explorer Initialization.
segment.target: Avoid placing applications in the RunOnce key on a recurring basis because it delays Explorer Initialization.

segment.source: Investigating specific issues during Explorer Initialization is beyond the scope of this document.
segment.target: Investigating specific issues during Explorer Initialization is beyond the scope of this document.

segment.source: For a list of common best practices, see Best Practices for Time-Critical Tasks.
segment.target: For a list of common best practices, see Best Practices for Time-Critical Tasks.

segment.source: Post On/Off Duration
segment.target: Post On/Off Duration

segment.source: Most Applicable to: Application developers
segment.target: Most Applicable to: Application developers

segment.source: Relevant Assessments:
segment.target: Relevant Assessments:

segment.source: Boot Performance (Fast Startup)
segment.target: Boot Performance (Fast Startup)

segment.source: Boot Performance (Full Boot)
segment.target: Boot Performance (Full Boot)

segment.source: Standby Performance
segment.target: Standby Performance

segment.source: Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Hibernate Performance

segment.source: This metric measures the time from the completion of Post On/Off to the system being reasonably idle and responsive to user input.
segment.target: This metric measures the time from the completion of Post On/Off to the system being reasonably idle and responsive to user input.

segment.source: The goal of this phase is to bind and quantify background processing that continues after the Start Screen displays.
segment.target: The goal of this phase is to bind and quantify background processing that continues after the Start Screen displays.

segment.source: This metric measures the duration of the Post On/Off phase, which represents the amount of time that is required for the system to accumulate 5 seconds of idle time.
segment.target: This metric measures the duration of the Post On/Off phase, which represents the amount of time that is required for the system to accumulate 5 seconds of idle time.

segment.source: This time is accumulated by checking the CPU and storage utilization in 500ms time windows.
segment.target: This time is accumulated by checking the CPU and storage utilization in 500ms time windows.

segment.source: If the cumulative time of both CPU and storage utilization is below 20%, the idle time of this window (500ms – max CPU time, Disk time in the window) is added to the total idle time until 5 seconds is reached.
segment.target: If the cumulative time of both CPU and storage utilization is below 20%, the idle time of this window (500ms – max CPU time, Disk time in the window) is added to the total idle time until 5 seconds is reached.

segment.source: The metric reports this duration minus the 5 seconds of collected idle time.
segment.target: The metric reports this duration minus the 5 seconds of collected idle time.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Low-priority CPU and storage utilization times are ignored for these calculations.
segment.target: Low-priority CPU and storage utilization times are ignored for these calculations.

segment.source: Any software component that is running during this phase can affect the phase duration by performing disk I/O or computation.
segment.target: Any software component that is running during this phase can affect the phase duration by performing disk I/O or computation.

segment.source: Detailed Sub-metrics
segment.target: Detailed Sub-metrics

segment.source: No actual sub-metrics exist for this phase; however, because the phase duration is proportional to resource utilization, you can gain insight by examining processes that are running during this phase (expand Processes per Phase in Windows Assessment Console).
segment.target: No actual sub-metrics exist for this phase; however, because the phase duration is proportional to resource utilization, you can gain insight by examining processes that are running during this phase (expand Processes per Phase in Windows Assessment Console).

segment.source: Typical Influencing Factors
segment.target: Typical Influencing Factors

segment.source: Any software components that utilize CPU or storage resources during this phase can potentially contribute to the overall time.
segment.target: Any software components that utilize CPU or storage resources during this phase can potentially contribute to the overall time.

segment.source: Additional startup applications usually have a negative impact on the Post On/Off phase.
segment.target: Additional startup applications usually have a negative impact on the Post On/Off phase.

segment.source: In the Standby Performance and Hibernate Performance scenarios, which do not log off the user session, this phase is affected by applications that are running in the current workload.
segment.target: In the Standby Performance and Hibernate Performance scenarios, which do not log off the user session, this phase is affected by applications that are running in the current workload.

segment.source: Analysis and Remediation Steps
segment.target: Analysis and Remediation Steps

segment.source: Identify processes that are consuming the most resources.
segment.target: Identify processes that are consuming the most resources.

segment.source: You can do this either by expanding Processes per Phase in Windows Assessment Console or by looking at CPU and disk utilization graphs and summary tables in WPA.
segment.target: You can do this either by expanding Processes per Phase in Windows Assessment Console or by looking at CPU and disk utilization graphs and summary tables in WPA.

segment.source: Issues are also likely to be generated for offending processes.
segment.target: Issues are also likely to be generated for offending processes.

segment.source: See Looking at resource utilization metrics for more details.
segment.target: See Looking at resource utilization metrics for more details.

segment.source: To address the issue for the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) and Boot Performance (Full Boot) assessments, consider removing non-essential applications from the startup path or use the Task Scheduler to start these applications at a later time.
segment.target: To address the issue for the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) and Boot Performance (Full Boot) assessments, consider removing non-essential applications from the startup path or use the Task Scheduler to start these applications at a later time.

segment.source: If an application is critical for user logon (for example, it provides credential provider services or network services), make sure that the application is optimized for minimal resource consumption.
segment.target: If an application is critical for user logon (for example, it provides credential provider services or network services), make sure that the application is optimized for minimal resource consumption.

segment.source: Avoid using managed code (CLR-based) startup applications because their initialization can activate the resource-costly initialization of .NET framework.
segment.target: Avoid using managed code (CLR-based) startup applications because their initialization can activate the resource-costly initialization of .NET framework.

segment.source: This will further impact Post On/Off phase times and degrade user responsiveness.
segment.target: This will further impact Post On/Off phase times and degrade user responsiveness.

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: The On/Off Transition Performance assessments perform advanced issue analysis and provide links to WPA to troubleshoot the issues that the assessment has identified.
segment.target: The On/Off Transition Performance assessments perform advanced issue analysis and provide links to WPA to troubleshoot the issues that the assessment has identified.

segment.source: When WPA opens, additional details about disk activity or CPU activity might be available, depending on the type of issue.
segment.target: When WPA opens, additional details about disk activity or CPU activity might be available, depending on the type of issue.

segment.source: This section describes common investigative techniques that you can use to analyze performance issues.
segment.target: This section describes common investigative techniques that you can use to analyze performance issues.

segment.source: Find the Largest Contributor
segment.target: Find the Largest Contributor

segment.source: Open the assessment results file in Windows Assessment Console and expand the corresponding parent metric.
segment.target: Open the assessment results file in Windows Assessment Console and expand the corresponding parent metric.

segment.source: The child sub-metrics typically provide information on specific components that affect the parent metric.
segment.target: The child sub-metrics typically provide information on specific components that affect the parent metric.

segment.source: For example, consider the Shutdown Processes Duration metric.
segment.target: For example, consider the Shutdown Processes Duration metric.

segment.source: You can expand the metric to view three sub-metric tables for this phase.
segment.target: You can expand the metric to view three sub-metric tables for this phase.

segment.source: The first two tables show the CPU and disk utilization, and the third table shows the durations of individual processes that are being shut down.
segment.target: The first two tables show the CPU and disk utilization, and the third table shows the durations of individual processes that are being shut down.

segment.source: Additional columns, such as the Detail column, provide more details for the sub-metrics.
segment.target: Additional columns, such as the Detail column, provide more details for the sub-metrics.

segment.source: In User Session Shutdown Processes, the Detail column shows a PID.
segment.target: In User Session Shutdown Processes, the Detail column shows a PID.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In the default view, the Detail column might contain the value “Various” because PIDs cannot be aggregated across iterations.
segment.target: In the default view, the Detail column might contain the value “Various” because PIDs cannot be aggregated across iterations.

segment.source: Expand iterations to see individual PIDs.
segment.target: Expand iterations to see individual PIDs.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Console allows you to sort the sub-metrics list by any data column (except for the top level Fast Startup phase lists, which are sorted by phase order during shutdown/boot).
segment.target: Windows Assessment Console allows you to sort the sub-metrics list by any data column (except for the top level Fast Startup phase lists, which are sorted by phase order during shutdown/boot).

segment.source: For example, in the expanded process list for the User Session Shutdown Processes phase, right-click the table header and then choose Sort rows descending.
segment.target: For example, in the expanded process list for the User Session Shutdown Processes phase, right-click the table header and then choose Sort rows descending.

segment.source: You can use this technique for multiple top level phase durations.
segment.target: You can use this technique for multiple top level phase durations.

segment.source: Look at Resource Utilization Metrics
segment.target: Look at Resource Utilization Metrics

segment.source: View the detailed resource utilization metrics for each process during this phase.
segment.target: View the detailed resource utilization metrics for each process during this phase.

segment.source: To retrieve this information, expand the processes for each phase tab in the section, and then sort by either CPU usage or total disk usage.
segment.target: To retrieve this information, expand the processes for each phase tab in the section, and then sort by either CPU usage or total disk usage.

segment.source: Additional Information
segment.target: Additional Information

segment.source: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations, see Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.
segment.target: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations, see Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.

segment.source: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006
segment.target: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006

segment.source: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.
segment.target: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.

segment.source: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.
segment.target: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.

segment.source: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:
segment.target: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:

segment.source: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.
segment.target: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.

segment.source: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:
segment.target: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:

segment.source: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.
segment.target: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.

segment.source: Best Practices for Time-Critical Tasks
segment.target: Best Practices for Time-Critical Tasks

segment.source: If you don’t want a task to be delayed, ensure it does not do anything which takes a long time.
segment.target: If you don’t want a task to be delayed, ensure it does not do anything which takes a long time.

segment.source: Below are some things to avoid.
segment.target: Below are some things to avoid.

segment.source: If a time-critical response is required, for example, to process the WMENDSESSION during shutdown, do not plan on doing any substantial work when receiving the request (aside from data reliability work like saving user modifications, which must be done).
segment.target: If a time-critical response is required, for example, to process the WMENDSESSION during shutdown, do not plan on doing any substantial work when receiving the request (aside from data reliability work like saving user modifications, which must be done).

segment.source: Avoid performing any operations which might take a longer time, unless absolutely necessary.
segment.target: Avoid performing any operations which might take a longer time, unless absolutely necessary.

segment.source: Defer them until the current time-critical task is complete.
segment.target: Defer them until the current time-critical task is complete.

segment.source: Avoid any APIs which contain the warning: “beware of performance considerations when using this API”.
segment.target: Avoid any APIs which contain the warning: “beware of performance considerations when using this API”.

segment.source: Avoid any network dependencies because any network request can be delayed by network issues.
segment.target: Avoid any network dependencies because any network request can be delayed by network issues.

segment.source: This is especially true for Startup and Shutdown scenarios since the network is not guaranteed to be available for the entire time.
segment.target: This is especially true for Startup and Shutdown scenarios since the network is not guaranteed to be available for the entire time.

segment.source: Avoid long timeouts.
segment.target: Avoid long timeouts.

segment.source: If a wait is required, ensure the wait time is reasonably bound by a small (in the context of the time critical task in question) timeout value.
segment.target: If a wait is required, ensure the wait time is reasonably bound by a small (in the context of the time critical task in question) timeout value.

segment.source: Avoid excessive computation.
segment.target: Avoid excessive computation.

segment.source: Keep in mind that processors vary in speed so a computation taking 100ms on a very fast computer might end up taking seconds on a slower one.
segment.target: Keep in mind that processors vary in speed so a computation taking 100ms on a very fast computer might end up taking seconds on a slower one.

segment.source: Avoid unnecessary storage I/O.
segment.target: Avoid unnecessary storage I/O.

segment.source: Any I/O request could be delayed by other components.
segment.target: Any I/O request could be delayed by other components.

segment.source: At any time there are dozens of application and services running on a typical system and the storage resources are limited.
segment.target: At any time there are dozens of application and services running on a typical system and the storage resources are limited.

segment.source: Your I/O request might get queued behind hundreds of similar requests from other components.
segment.target: Your I/O request might get queued behind hundreds of similar requests from other components.

segment.source: Avoid disk flushes, for example, those initiated through calling FlushFileBuffers API.
segment.target: Avoid disk flushes, for example, those initiated through calling FlushFileBuffers API.

segment.source: Flushing causes the disk stack to delete its caches and is supposed to force the hard drive to write out data in its RAM buffers.
segment.target: Flushing causes the disk stack to delete its caches and is supposed to force the hard drive to write out data in its RAM buffers.

segment.source: Typically, this operation is very costly and does not guarantee data consistency since the hard drives often ignore the request.
segment.target: Typically, this operation is very costly and does not guarantee data consistency since the hard drives often ignore the request.

segment.source: Avoid flushing registry hives by calling RegFlushKey API.
segment.target: Avoid flushing registry hives by calling RegFlushKey API.

segment.source: Because of registry design, the API is causing modified data for the entire hive to be flushed to disk, which is a very costly operation.
segment.target: Because of registry design, the API is causing modified data for the entire hive to be flushed to disk, which is a very costly operation.

segment.source: Flushing registry keys is an action that is not typically needed since the operating system provides a consistent registry view to all the components.
segment.target: Flushing registry keys is an action that is not typically needed since the operating system provides a consistent registry view to all the components.

segment.source: Also, the registry itself does asynchronous flushes every several seconds.
segment.target: Also, the registry itself does asynchronous flushes every several seconds.

segment.source: Avoid opening new RPC connections since the RPC authentication process is costly.
segment.target: Avoid opening new RPC connections since the RPC authentication process is costly.

segment.source: Establishing a new RPC connection involves costly security checks.
segment.target: Establishing a new RPC connection involves costly security checks.

segment.source: Avoid calling transactional APIs such as TxF APIs as they commonly perform a number of costly operations for each API call.
segment.target: Avoid calling transactional APIs such as TxF APIs as they commonly perform a number of costly operations for each API call.

segment.source: These APIs obtain reliability at the cost of performance, so these APIs should not be used during time-critical tasks.
segment.target: These APIs obtain reliability at the cost of performance, so these APIs should not be used during time-critical tasks.
